page.title: 16THE FORCES:CHERRY WILLINGHAM
page.content: There is an army cadet group in Cherry Willingham with a hut in the grounds of the comprehensive school. They meet once a week and practice on the school field. The navy has no direct activity in our block although the R.A.F. Nimrod passes over about five or six times a day. It is based at a local R.A.F. station and Cherry Willingham is on the flight path for the planes. In all there are up to 70 planes a day over the area most of them being R.A.F. fighter planes. We also have the 'Red Arrows' team over the area at least once a week if they are not away giving a performance. Some of the members of the Royal Observer Corps, which has a station just outside our block live in the the area. S.CLARKSON
